title: Grocery Store Receipts
question_text:
Suppose at a local grocery store, the average customer’s bill is $\$98.22$ with a standard deviation of $\$45.10$.
One day, the manager is surprised to see the next $5$ randomly selected receipts averaged $\$150$. The next day, the manager was even more surprised to see the next $5$ randomly selected receipts were each greater than $\$150$.
Use the probability of each event to find which occurrence is more surprising.

choices.text: There is not enough information to determine the answer to this question.

solution:
First, find the probability of finding $5$ receipts that average $\$150$.

Use the equation below, where $n = 5, σ = 45.1, x = 150$, and $µ =98.22$, to find a z-score of $2.57$:

$$z=\dfrac{\bar{X} - \mu}{\frac{\sigma}{\sqrt{n}}}$$

Use the standard normal table to find:

$$P (z>2.57) = 1-0.9949 = 0.0051$$

To find the probability of $5$ receipts that are greater than $\$150$, first, find the probability of one receipt being over $\$150$.

Use the equation below, where $σ = 45.1, n = 1, x = 150$, and $µ = 98.22$, to find the $z = 1.15$:

$$z=\dfrac{\bar{X} - \mu}{\frac{\sigma}{\sqrt{n}}}$$

$$P (z>1.15) = 1-0.8749 = 0.1251$$

This represents the probability of $1$ receipt being greater than $\$150$.

The probability of $5$ receipts each being over $\$150$ is:

$$0.1251^5= 0.0000306$$

Thus, the correct answer is Choice 'B'.
